title: Salami And Brussels Sprouts Pizza
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Salami And Brussels Sprouts Pizzan a try. This recipe serves 4. One portion of this dish contains about 27g of protein, 39g of fat, and a total of 695 calories. For $3.22 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of brussels sprouts, greens, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the pizza dough you could follow this main course with the Grilled Dessert Pizza as a dessert. 93 people have tried and liked this recipe. A couple people really liked this Mediterranean dish. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 83%. This score is amazing. Try Brussels Sprouts & Pepperoni Pizza, Brussels Sprouts and Bacon Pizza, and Brussels Sprouts and Bacon Pizza for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Italian on the menu? Try pairing with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Piccini Chianti Classico. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 10 dollars.

productMatches.title: Piccini Chianti Classico
productMatches.description: Bright ruby with a hint of purple. Plum, violet notes mix with lush, ripe wild berries. Expansive and alive on the palate, with a lingering, velvety mouth feel. The long finish is buried in fruit.A versatile wine, best served at 64ÂºF, fantastic with juicy red meats, grilled or roasted.
